channel.title: Book of Exodus on ✟ Christian Writings ✟
channel.description: Recent content in Book of Exodus on ✟ Christian Writings ✟

item.title: Exodus 1
item.description: v1 Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, who came into Egypt (every man and his household came with Jacob):

item.title: Exodus 2
item.description: v1 A man of the house of Levi went and took a daughter of Levi as his wife.

item.title: Exodus 3
item.description: v1 Now Moses was keeping the flock of Jethro, his father-in-law, the priest of Midian, and he led the flock to the back of the wilderness, and came to God’s mountain, to Horeb.

item.title: Exodus 4
item.description: v1 Moses answered, “But, behold, they will not believe me, nor listen to my voice; for they will say, ‘Yahweh has not appeared to you.

item.title: Exodus 5
item.description: v1 Afterward Moses and Aaron came, and said to Pharaoh, “This is what Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, ‘Let my people go, that they may hold a feast to me in the wilderness.

item.title: Exodus 6
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Moses, “Now you shall see what I will do to Pharaoh, for by a strong hand he shall let them go, and by a strong hand he shall drive them out of his land.

item.title: Exodus 7
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Moses, “Behold, I have made you as God to Pharaoh; and Aaron your brother shall be your prophet.

item.title: Exodus 8
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, “Go in to Pharaoh, and tell him, ‘This is what Yahweh says, “Let my people go, that they may serve me.

item.title: Exodus 9
item.description: v1 Then Yahweh said to Moses, “Go in to Pharaoh, and tell him, ‘This is what Yahweh, the God of the Hebrews, says: “Let my people go, that they may serve me.

item.title: Exodus 10
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Moses, “Go in to Pharaoh, for I have hardened his heart and the heart of his servants, that I may show these my signs among them;

item.title: Exodus 11
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Moses, “I will bring yet one more plague on Pharaoh, and on Egypt; afterwards he will let you go.

item.title: Exodus 12
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,

item.title: Exodus 13
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Sanctify to me all the firstborn, whatever opens the womb among the children of Israel, both of man and of animal.

item.title: Exodus 14
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Speak to the children of Israel, that they turn back and encamp before Pihahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, before Baal Zephon.

item.title: Exodus 15
item.description: v1 Then Moses and the children of Israel sang this song to Yahweh, and said, “I will sing to Yahweh, for he has triumphed gloriously.

item.title: Exodus 16
item.description: v1 They took their journey from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came to the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.

item.title: Exodus 17
item.description: v1 All the congregation of the children of Israel traveled from the wilderness of Sin, starting according to Yahweh’s commandment, and encamped in Rephidim; but there was no water for the people to drink.

item.title: Exodus 18
item.description: v1 Now Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses and for Israel his people, how Yahweh had brought Israel out of Egypt.

item.title: Exodus 19
item.description: v1 In the third month after the children of Israel had gone out of the land of Egypt, on that same day they came into the wilderness of Sinai.

item.title: Exodus 20
item.description: v1 God spoke all these words, saying, v2 “I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

item.title: Exodus 21
item.description: v1 “Now these are the ordinances which you shall set before them:

item.title: Exodus 22
item.description: v1 “If a man steals an ox or a sheep, and kills it or sells it, he shall pay five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.

item.title: Exodus 23
item.description: v1 “You shall not spread a false report. Don’t join your hand with the wicked to be a malicious witness.

item.title: Exodus 24
item.description: v1 He said to Moses, “Come up to Yahweh, you, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship from a distance.

item.title: Exodus 25
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Speak to the children of Israel, that they take an offering for me.

item.title: Exodus 26
item.description: v1 “Moreover you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, with cherubim.

item.title: Exodus 27
item.description: v1 “You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long, and five cubits wide.

item.title: Exodus 28
item.description: v1 “Bring Aaron your brother, and his sons with him, near to you from among the children of Israel, that he may minister to me in the priest’s office: Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s sons.

item.title: Exodus 29
item.description: v1 “This is the thing that you shall do to them to make them holy, to minister to me in the priest’s office: take one young bull and two rams without defect,

item.title: Exodus 30
item.description: v1 “You shall make an altar to burn incense on. You shall make it of acacia wood.

item.title: Exodus 31
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Behold, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.

item.title: Exodus 32
item.description: v1 When the people saw that Moses delayed coming down from the mountain, the people gathered themselves together to Aaron, and said to him, “Come, make us gods, which shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we don’t know what has become of him.

item.title: Exodus 33
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, “Depart, go up from here, you and the people that you have brought up out of the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, ‘I will give it to your offspring.

item.title: Exodus 34
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Moses, “Chisel two stone tablets like the first.

item.title: Exodus 35
item.description: v1 Moses assembled all the congregation of the children of Israel, and said to them, “These are the words which Yahweh has commanded, that you should do them.

item.title: Exodus 36
item.description: v1 “Bezalel and Oholiab shall work with every wise-hearted man, in whom Yahweh has put wisdom and understanding to know how to do all the work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that Yahweh has commanded.

item.title: Exodus 37
item.description: v1 Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood. Its length was two and a half cubits, and its width a cubit and a half, and a cubit and a half its height.

item.title: Exodus 38
item.description: v1 He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood.

item.title: Exodus 39
item.description: v1 Of the blue, purple, and scarlet, they made finely worked garments for ministering in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

item.title: Exodus 40
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “On the first day of the first month you shall raise up the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting.
